description: High severity SIEM alert: Windows Defender detected potentially unwanted software Trojan:PowerShell/PSAttackTool.A on host NUW-BEST-16

High severity SIEM alert: Windows Defender detected a potentially unwanted software (Trojan:PowerShell/PSAttackTool.A) on host NUW-BEST-16. This is a serious threat, as it is a trojan horse that can compromise the system and user.
High severity SIEM alert: Windows Defender detected potentially unwanted software Trojan:PowerShell/PSAttackTool.A on host NUW-BEST-16.

A high severity event has occurred where Trojan:PowerShell/PSAttackTool.A was detected on host NUW-BEST-16 by Microsoft Defender Antivirus. This is a serious threat, as it indicates the presence of potentially unwanted software or malware on the system.

Windows Defender detected potentially unwanted software, Trojan:PowerShell/PSAttackTool.A, which is a high severity threat. This trojan horse was found in the Windows PowerShell process on the host NUW-BEST-16.
